info.description: Documentation of the Market Data API.
info.title: Market Data API.

get.description: Retrieves all API keys associated with the specified user ID.

parameters.description: The user ID to list API keys for
parameters.name: user_id

post.description: Creates a new API key with the specified name and permissions for the given user.

get.description: Returns the years for which industry and sector mean data are available.
Retrieves the chat history for the specified row key from BigTable.

parameters.description: The row key to get chat history from
parameters.name: rowKey

post.description: Creates a new chat conversation with the specified messages at the given row key.

parameters.description: The row key to create the chat at
parameters.name: rowKey

delete.description: Removes the specified row from the chat table in BigTable.

parameters.description: The row key to delete from the chat table
parameters.name: rowKey

get.description:
This will retrieve the most recent trade data for the specified stock symbol including
current price, bid/ask prices, trade size, and other market data from Redis.

parameters.description: The stock symbol to get the current price for
parameters.name: symbol

get.description:
Retrieves the top K darkpool trends based on the provided count and start date.
Data is fetched from cache if available, otherwise from the primary service.

parameters.description: Number of darkpool trends to return.
parameters.name: k

parameters.description: Use dollar weighed volumes instead of raw volumes.
parameters.name: useDollar

get.description:
Retrieves daily darkpool trend metrics for the specified ticker within the given date range.
If no dates are provided, defaults to the last 30 days.

parameters.description: The ticker symbol to fetch trends for.
parameters.name: ticker

get.description:
Retrieves dark-pool trades in the requested date window with optional
price/size/value filters and consolidation.
The system uses a two-tier cache (ST for last 2 days, LT for last 60 days)
and falls back to QuestDB when cache misses or filters don't match.
Current price is attached in parallel.

parameters.description: The ticker symbol to fetch trades for.
parameters.name: ticker

parameters.description: Maximum number of trades to return.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: Minimum size of trades to return.
parameters.name: min_size

parameters.description: Maximum size of trades to return.
parameters.name: max_size

parameters.description: Minimum price of trades to return.
parameters.name: min_price

parameters.description: Maximum price of trades to return.
parameters.name: max_price

get.description: Retrieves dividends calendar data for the upcoming week from the cache.
Dividends for a single symbol.
Retrieves earnings data for the upcoming week from the cache.

Retrieves holdings data for a specific entity, with optional filtering by ticker symbol and date range.
Returns enriched holdings data including fund names, entity names, and ticker symbols.

parameters.description: Entity ID to fetch holdings for
parameters.name: entity_id

parameters.description: Ticker symbol to filter holdings for
parameters.name: ticker

parameters.description: Maximum number of records to return
parameters.name: limit

get.description:
Retrieves estimate data for multiple tickers, metrics, and financial periods.
Financial periods must be in format YYYY_Q[1-4] or YYYY_FY (e.g., 2025_Q1, 2025_FY).
Metrics include standard estimates (EPS, SAL, etc.), price targets (PTG), and long-term growth (LTG).

parameters.description: Comma-separated list of stock ticker symbols (e.g., "AAPL,NVDA,META").
parameters.name: tickers

parameters.description: Comma-separated list of financial periods in format YYYY_Q[1-4] or YYYY_FY (e.g., "2025_Q1,2025_Q2,2025_FY,2026_FY").
parameters.name: financial_periods

parameters.description: Comma-separated list of metrics to retrieve (e.g., "EPS,SAL,ROE,PTG,LTG").
parameters.name: metrics

get.description:
Retrieves Long-Term Growth (LTG) estimate data for a given stock ticker.
An optional cutOff date can be provided to retrieve data as of that date.

parameters.description: Optional cut-off date (e.g., 'YYYY-MM-DD') to retrieve estimates as of a specific date.
parameters.name: cutOff

get.description:
Retrieves the most recent estimate metrics (e.g., EPS, Sales) for a given stock ticker,
for a specified period type (ANN or QTR).
An optional cutOff date can be provided to retrieve data as of that date.

parameters.description: Optional cut-off date (e.g., 'YYYY-MM-DD') to retrieve estimates as of a specific date.
parameters.name: cutOff

parameters.description: Start date (e.g., 'YYYY-MM-DD') to retrieve estimates from a specific date.
parameters.name: start

parameters.description: End date (e.g., 'YYYY-MM-DD') to retrieve estimates to a specific date.
parameters.name: end

get.description:
Retrieves price target estimate data for a given stock ticker.
An optional cutOff date can be provided to retrieve data as of that date.

parameters.description: Optional cut-off date (e.g., 'YYYY-MM-DD') to retrieve estimates as of a specific date.
parameters.name: cutOff

get.description: Retrieves the historical Fear & Greed Index data.

Retrieves holdings data for a specific fund, with optional filtering by ticker symbol and date range.
Returns enriched holdings data including fund names, entity names, and ticker symbols.

parameters.description: Fund ID to fetch holdings for
parameters.name: fund_id

parameters.description: Ticker symbol to filter holdings for
parameters.name: ticker

parameters.description: Maximum number of records to return
parameters.name: limit

get.description: Balance-sheet, cash-flow, income & ratios for many tickers across a year span.
Balance-sheet, cash-flow, income & ratios for one specific year & reporting period (FY, Q1â€’Q4).
Balance-sheet, cash-flow, income & ratios for one ticker across a year span.
Retrieves futures data for a specified ticker symbol within a given date range.

parameters.description: Ticker symbol for the futures data.
parameters.name: ticker

get.description: Retrieves all contract naming information from the globex futures ID mapping table.
Retrieves contract naming information for a single futures contract by its code (e.g., "ES").
Performs fuzzy search on futures contract naming data with optional filters.
Returns autocomplete suggestions for a given field and prefix.

parameters.description: Field to get suggestions for (asset_class, exchange, product_group, product_name)
parameters.name: field

get.description: Returns unique values for specified field or all fields.
get.summary: Unique values for contract naming fields

parameters.description: Field to get unique values for (asset_class, cleared_as, exchange, product_group, all)
parameters.name: field

get.description: Retrieves all available futures contracts (security type = FUT).
Retrieves all contracts (both futures and options) for a specific underlying asset.
Retrieves only futures contracts (security type = FUT) for a specific underlying asset.
Retrieves only options on futures contracts (security type = OOF) for a specific underlying asset.
Retrieves the instrument ID for a given futures contract symbol.

Searches for futures contracts based on various criteria including asset, security type, and instrument class.
At least one search criterion must be provided.

Note: When searching by instrumentClass alone, securityType is required. However, instrumentClass
filtering is supported in all search combinations and will be applied as a post-filter when necessary.

parameters.description: Filter by security type ("FUT" for futures, "OOF" for options on futures)
parameters.name: securityType

parameters.description: Filter by instrument class (e.g., "F" for futures, "S" for spreads, "C" for calls, "P" for puts)
parameters.name: instrumentClass

parameters.description: The asset of the futures contract
parameters.name: asset

parameters.description: The raw symbol of the futures contract
parameters.name: raw_symbol

parameters.description: The asset of the futures contract
parameters.name: asset

parameters.description: The raw symbol of the futures contract
parameters.name: raw_symbol

parameters.description: The start date of the trades
parameters.name: start_date

parameters.description: The end date of the trades
parameters.name: end_date

get.description: Retrieves all available options on futures contracts (security type = OOF).

parameters.description: The asset of the futures contract
parameters.name: asset

parameters.description: The raw symbol of the futures contract
parameters.name: raw_symbol

parameters.description: The start date of the trades
parameters.name: start_date

parameters.description: The end date of the trades
parameters.name: end_date

get.description: Retrieves G7 events data for the upcoming week from the cache.

This will retrieve historical grades data for the specified stock symbol from Bigtable.
Returns an array of grade objects with analyst ratings breakdown.

parameters.description: The stock symbol to get grades for
parameters.name: symbol

parameters.description: Maximum number of grades to return (default: 100, max: 1000)
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: Start date filter in YYYY-MM-DD format (optional)
parameters.name: start_date

parameters.description: End date filter in YYYY-MM-DD format (optional)
parameters.name: end_date

get.description:
This will retrieve historical price data for the specified stock symbol, aggregated by the given period,
within the specified start and end dates. All prices are automatically adjusted for stock splits to ensure
historical comparability with current prices.

parameters.description: The start date for historical data (YYYY-MM-DD)
parameters.name: start

parameters.description: The end date for historical data (YYYY-MM-DD)
parameters.name: end

get.description: Returns the calculated mean values for all financial metrics for a specific industry, year, and period.

parameters.description: The period (FY, Q1, Q2, Q3, Q4)
parameters.name: period

get.description: Returns the calculated mean values for all industries for a specific year and period.

parameters.description: The period (FY, Q1, Q2, Q3, Q4)
parameters.name: period

get.description: Returns up to the first 100 investors whose names start with the supplied prefix.
Retrieves IPO data for the upcoming week from the cache.
Fetches the current market status from Polygon.io and returns whether the market is considered open.

Retrieves the top market stocks data based on the specified type.
The type parameter determines whether to fetch top gainers, losers, or most active stocks.

parameters.description: The type of stocks to fetch (gainers, losers, or active)
parameters.name: type

get.description:
This will retrieve the market snapshot for all available tickers
with their current price and today's change

Retrieves news articles based on specified filter criteria such as date range,
ticker symbol, search text, sentiment score, market impact, and  .
Supports pagination via the limit parameter.
Returns available filter values for news articles including sources, tickers, themes, and sentiment labels.
Retrieves sentiment scores for a ticker over the past 30 days.
Retrieves a news article by its unique ID.

parameters.description: Unique ID of the news article
parameters.name: id

get.description:
Retrieves comprehensive options chain data for a given underlying ticker symbol.
When calculate_put_call_ratio is set to true and contract_type is 'both', the response
will include put/call ratio analysis which is useful for market sentiment analysis.

parameters.description: The underlying ticker symbol (e.g., AAPL, TSLA, SPY)
parameters.name: ticker

parameters.description: Start date for options expiration range (YYYY-MM-DD format)
parameters.name: start_date

parameters.description: End date for options expiration range (YYYY-MM-DD format)
parameters.name: end_date

get.description: Retrieves comprehensive options extra info data for a given underlying ticker symbol.
Returns the minimum and maximum values for all filterable fields in the options chain data.

parameters.description: The underlying ticker symbol (e.g., AAPL, TSLA, SPY)
parameters.name: ticker

parameters.description: Start date for options expiration range (YYYY-MM-DD format)
parameters.name: start_date

parameters.description: End date for options expiration range (YYYY-MM-DD format)
parameters.name: end_date

get.description:
This will retrieve historical price data for the specified options symbol, aggregated by the given period,
within the specified start and end dates.

parameters.description: The start date for historical data (YYYY-MM-DD)
parameters.name: start

parameters.description: The end date for historical data (YYYY-MM-DD)
parameters.name: end

get.description:
Retrieves historical aggregate price data (OHLCV bars) for a specific options contract.
Both start_date and end_date are required parameters and should be provided in YYYY-MM-DD format.

parameters.description: Start date for historical data (YYYY-MM-DD format)
parameters.name: start_date

parameters.description: End date for historical data (YYYY-MM-DD format)
parameters.name: end_date

parameters.description: Time multiplier for the interval (e.g., 5 for 5-minute bars)
parameters.name: time_break

get.description: Retrieves comprehensive options market summary data for a given underlying ticker symbol.
Returns a map where each key is a ticker symbol and the value is an array of forecast data points.

parameters.description: The number of days to forecast (1â€“10)
parameters.name: forecast_horizon

parameters.description: Comma-separated list of stock ticker symbols
parameters.name: tickers

get.description:
This will retrieve historical ratings data for the specified stock symbol from Bigtable.
Returns an array of rating objects with scores and recommendations.

parameters.description: The stock symbol to get ratings for
parameters.name: symbol

parameters.description: Maximum number of ratings to return (default: 100, max: 1000)
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: Start date filter in YYYY-MM-DD format (optional)
parameters.name: start_date

parameters.description: End date filter in YYYY-MM-DD format (optional)
parameters.name: end_date

get.description: Revenue geographic segmentation data for a single symbol.

parameters.description: The period type (FY for annual, Q for quarters, or ALL for all periods)
parameters.name: period

get.description: Revenue product segmentation data for a single symbol.

parameters.description: The period type (FY for annual, Q for quarters, or ALL for all periods)
parameters.name: period

get.description: Retrieves the historical Risk Analysis Score data.
Searches for entities based on a query term, field, mode, and limit.

parameters.description: Maximum number of results to return
parameters.name: limit

get.description: Searches for funds based on a query term, field, mode, and limit.

parameters.description: Maximum number of results to return
parameters.name: limit

get.description: Searches for Fsyms (stocks) based on a query term, field, mode, and limit.

parameters.description: Maximum number of results to return
parameters.name: limit

get.description: Searches for news articles based on a query term, field, mode, and limit.

parameters.description: Search term (optional - if not provided, filters will be used)
parameters.name: q

parameters.description: Field to search in (e.g., all, title, summary, analysis, tickers, themes, source, sentiment_label, url)
parameters.name: field

parameters.description: Start date for the search range (YYYY-MM-DD)
parameters.name: start_date

parameters.description: End date for the search range (YYYY-MM-DD)
parameters.name: end_date

parameters.description: Search mode (smart=intelligent multi-strategy search, fuzzy=flexible matching, and/strict=all words required, exact=phrase match, wildcard=contains with OR, or/any=any word matches, prefix=starts with, semantic-vector-search=AI-powered semantic search)
parameters.name: mode

parameters.description: Maximum number of results to return
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: Comma-separated sentiment labels to filter by (e.g., positive,neutral)
parameters.name: filter_sentiment_label

parameters.description: Comma-separated themes to filter by. Articles must contain at least one of the specified themes. URL encode & symbols as %26
parameters.name: filter_themes

parameters.description: Comma-separated tickers to filter by. Articles must contain at least one of the specified tickers
parameters.name: filter_tickers

parameters.description: Source/publisher to filter by (supports fuzzy matching for variations like "Goldman Sachs" vs "GoldmanSachs")
parameters.name: filter_source

parameters.description: Enable fuzzy matching for source names (default: true)
parameters.name: source_fuzzy_match

get.description: Searches for unstructured documents using vector similarity search.

parameters.description: Filter results to only include unstructured data type
parameters.name: filter_data_type

get.description: Checks if the unstructured data search service is healthy.
Returns the calculated mean values for all financial metrics for a specific sector, year, and period.

parameters.description: The period (FY, Q1, Q2, Q3, Q4)
parameters.name: period

get.description: Returns the calculated mean values for all sectors for a specific year and period.

parameters.description: The period (FY, Q1, Q2, Q3, Q4)
parameters.name: period

post.description:
Filters stocks based on the provided financial criteria and returns
matching ticker symbols. The screening is performed against historical
financial data up to the specified cutoff date.

get.description: Retrieves the stock split history for a given ticker symbol from Redis cache.
This will calculate Fibonacci retracement levels and Camarilla pivot points for the specified stock symbol
Returns all tracked tickers and their sectors.
Returns the JSON profile for the specified symbol.
Returns the full list of symbols from cache or Bigtable.
Returns all tracked tickers and their profiles.
This will retrieve the current market data for a predefined list of popular stock tickers

This will retrieve recent trades data for the specified stock symbol from Redis
using the TICKER_TRADES sorted set key pattern. Each trade is decompressed if stored as gzip.
Returns an array of trade objects with pricing, volume, and market data.

parameters.description: The stock symbol to get trades for
parameters.name: symbol

parameters.description: Maximum number of trades to return (default: 100)
parameters.name: limit

get.description: Retrieves the earnings call transcript for a specific company, year, and quarter.

parameters.description: The quarter of the transcript (e.g., 4 or Q4).
parameters.name: quarter

get.description:
Retrieves treasury rates data from Bigtable for the specified date range.
If no dates are provided, returns data for the current date.

parameters.description: Start date for the range (YYYY-MM-DD format)
parameters.name: start_date

parameters.description: End date for the range (YYYY-MM-DD format)
parameters.name: end_date

get.description:
Retrieves unusual trading activities from QuestDB. These are options trades that exhibit
unusual patterns such as large size relative to the 99th percentile for that ticker.

parameters.description: Maximum number of records to return (default: 100, max: 1000)
parameters.name: limit

get.description: Retrieves unusual trading activities for a specific options symbol from QuestDB.

parameters.description: The options symbol to get unusual activities for
parameters.name: symbol

parameters.description: Maximum number of records to return (default: 50, max: 500)
parameters.name: limit

get.description:
This will retrieve dataset information for the specified stock symbol, showing total volume
grouped by dataset from the equities_ohlcv_1h_data table for a specific date.

This endpoint provides intraday volume analysis for a specific ticker and date, showing:
Total volume for the specified date and interval
3-day average volume for comparison
Volume analysis at different time intervals (15m by default)

The analysis uses QuestDB to calculate volume metrics with configurable sampling intervals
and provides insights into intraday trading patterns and volume trends.

parameters.description: The lookback period in days for average calculation (default: 3)
parameters.name: lookback

get.description:
This endpoint provides detailed volume footprint analysis for all available trades including:
Price action analysis (OHLC, VWAP)
Volume distribution by price level
Order flow imbalances between buy and sell orders
Volume clusters indicating high activity zones
Absorption signals for potential exhaustion points
Point of Control (POC) - price level with highest volume
Value Area High/Low for 70% of traded volume
Delta percentage to gauge buying vs selling pressure

The analysis is based on all available trade data from Redis and calculates comprehensive
market microstructure metrics useful for understanding market dynamics.

post.description:
Retrieves data for a specified list of stock tickers within a given date range.
The request parameters are passed in the request body.

get.description: Retrieves the tickers or data associated with a specific dashboard watchlist ID.

parameters.description: ID of the watchlist to retrieve.
parameters.name: watchlist_id

get.description: Retrieves the predictions for a specific watchlist ID.

parameters.description: ID of the watchlist to retrieve predictions for.
parameters.name: watchlist_id

success.description: Indicates if the request was successful

SearchNewsResponse.description: SearchNewsResponse is the response for the news search endpoint.

APIKey.description: APIKey represents an API key with its metadata

AnalysisResults.description: AnalysisResults contains the results of Fibonacci and Camarilla analysis

CamarillaLevel.description: CamarillaLevel stores a Camarilla pivot point

instrumentId.description: The instrument ID for the contract

symbol.description: The contract symbol that was searched

ContractInfo.title: ContractInfo represents parsed contract information from a Redis key.

type.description: Type of contracts (only included for futures/options specific endpoints)

DarkpoolTrade.title: DarkpoolTrade represents a dark pool trade data record.

absolute_volume_change.description: The percentage change in volume from previous date

prev_dollar_volume.description: The previous day's total dollar volume

prev_record_date.description: The date of the previous record

record_date.description: The date of the record in YYYY-MM-DD format

relative_volume_change.description: The percentage change in volume from previous date

total_dollar_volume.description: The total dollar volume of darkpool trades

total_volume.description: The total volume of darkpool trades for this ticker on this date

trend.description: Whether the volume trend is up, down, or flat

data.description: The contract naming data mapped by row key

end_date.description:
The end date for the data range (YYYY-MM-DD).
in: body
required: false (will use default if not provided)

start_date.description:
The start date for the data range (YYYY-MM-DD).
in: body
required: false (will use default if not provided)

ticker_infos.description:
A list of ticker symbols for which to fetch data.
in: body

FibonacciRetractmentLevel.description: FibonacciRetractmentLevel stores a Fibonacci retracement level with its ratio and value

metric.description: The financial metric to filter on (e.g., "eps", "revenue", "current_ratio")

value.description: The value to compare against (can be number or string)

FilterRange.description: FilterRange represents min/max values for a numeric field

FormattedOptionsContract.title: FormattedOptionsContract represents a flattened options contract structure.

suggestions.description: The suggestions for the given field and prefix

cik.description: CIK (Central Index Key) of the holder

IndustryMeanData.description: IndustryMeanData represents the calculated mean values for an industry

MarketSnapshotItem.description: MarketSnapshotItem represents a single ticker item in the market snapshot

MultiMetricEstimatesResponse.description: MultiMetricEstimatesResponse represents the response for the unified estimates endpoint with multiple metrics and periods

analysis.example: The International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) has reported an inability to currently verify the location of Iran's significant 409-kilogram stockpile of near-bomb-grade enriched uranium...

decisions_for_investors.example: ["Investors should anticipate heightened volatility, particularly in energy markets and assets sensitive to Middle Eastern geopolitical risk...", ]

summary.example: The UN nuclear watchdog, IAEA, reports that the location of Iran's 409-kilogram stockpile of near-bomb-grade enriched uranium...

title.example: Iran Near-Bomb-Grade Uranium's Location Uncertain, UN Watchdog Says

NewsMetadataFilter.title: NewsMetadataFilter represents the structure for a single filter's metadata.

NewsMetadataFilters.title: NewsMetadataFilters provides a structured way to represent all available filters.

NewsMetadataFiltersResponse.title: NewsMetadataFiltersResponse is the top-level response structure for the news metadata filters endpoint.

OptionsFilterRanges.description: OptionsFilterRanges contains min/max values for all filterable fields

OptionsHistoricalData.description: OptionsHistoricalData represents historical options OHLCV data from QuestDB

PriceForecastItem.title: PriceForecastItem represents a single price forecast for a ticker.

criteria.description: List of filter criteria to apply to stocks

cutoff_date.description: Cut-off date in ISO format (YYYY-MM-DD or YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS)

period.description: Period type for screening (QUARTERLY or ANNUAL)

error.description: Error message if success is false

success.description: Indicates if the request was successful

matching_tickers.description:
List of matching tickers with their metric values
Each object contains the ticker symbol, report_date, and the values for requested metrics

summary.example: The UN nuclear watchdog, IAEA, reports that the location of Iran's 409-kilogram stockpile of near-bomb-grade enriched uranium...

title.example: Iran Near-Bomb-Grade Uranium's Location Uncertain, UN Watchdog Says

SymbolOhlcvStats.title: NewTopMarketStocksService creates a new instance of TopMarketStocksService.

description.example: Apple Inc. is a technology company that designs, manufactures, and markets smartphones, tablets, personal computers, and accessories.

data.example: {"AAPL": { sector:"Technology", industry: "Consumer Electronics"}, "GOOGL": { sector:"Technology", industry: "Internet Content & Information"}, "AMZN": { sector:"Consumer Cyclical", industry: "Internet Retail"}, "GOOG": { sector:"Technology", industry: "Internet Content & Information"}, "NVDA": { sector:"Technology", industry: "Semiconductors"}, "TSLA": { sector:"Consumer Cyclical", industry: "Auto Manufacturers"}, "META": { sector:"Technology", industry: "Internet Content & Information"}, "NFLX": { sector:"Communication Services", industry: "Entertainment"}, "DIS": { sector:"Communication Services", industry: "Entertainment"}, "BRK.B": { sector:"Financial Services", industry: "Insurance - Diversified"}}

TradeData.description: TradeData represents individual trade data from the sorted set

parsed.description: Parsed content of the transcript. This is present if the content could be parsed into speaker segments.

raw.description: Raw content of the transcript. This is present if parsing failed.

TreasuryRatesData.description: TreasuryRatesData represents treasury rates for a single date

UnifiedEstimateValue.description: UnifiedEstimateValue represents the value for a single ticker and metric

UnifiedEstimatesResponse.description: UnifiedEstimatesResponse represents the response for the unified estimates endpoint

UnstructuredHealthResponse.description: UnstructuredHealthResponse represents the health check response

UnstructuredSearchResponse.description: UnstructuredSearchResponse represents the response for unstructured data search

UnstructuredSearchResultItem.description: UnstructuredSearchResultItem represents an individual search result

UnusualActivitiesResponse.description: UnusualActivitiesResponse represents the response for unusual activities

UnusualActivityData.description: UnusualActivityData represents a single unusual trading activity
